qas.question: What were the hunger strikers hoping to draw attention to?
When did the Lviv regional Memorial Society have its first conference?
How many people attended the services in western Ukraine?

context: From mid-May to September 1989, Ukrainian Greek-Catholic hunger strikers staged protests on Moscow's Arbat to call attention to the <a0_0>plight of their Church.<a0_0/> They were especially active during the July session of the World Council of Churches held in Moscow. The protest ended with the arrests of the group on September 18. On <a1_0>May 27, 1989<a1_0/>, the founding conference of the Lviv regional Memorial Society was held. On June 18, 1989, <a2_0>an estimated 100,000<a2_0/> faithful participated in public religious services in Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine, responding to Cardinal Myroslav Lubachivsky's call for an international day of prayer.
